definition: to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: He had come to India to get instruments and other paraphernalia.
sentences.chinese: 他于是到印度置办乐器和各种用具。

sentences.english: If i can, I'll make a workroom to my bro'.
sentences.chinese: 如果我可以，我会给小龙置办一个工作室。

sentences.english: Those who participate in the organization of the wedding are called the bridal party.
sentences.chinese: 参与置办婚礼的人被称作“新人亲友团”。

sentences.english: Those who participate in the organization of the wedding are called bridal party.
sentences.chinese: 参与置办婚礼的人被称作“新人亲友团”。

sentences.english: Rapid response teams were deployed. Equipment was organized.
sentences.chinese: 迅速部署了应对小组，置办了设备，并设立了隔离区。

sentences.english: Getting out of debt must be placed before buying anything new.
sentences.chinese: 必须先还清债务然后再置办物品。

definition: to buy/to acquire/to add to one's possessions
to prepare/to arrange (sth to be offered)
to provide (items for an event)/to cater/to make preparations
dowry/to give as a dowry/to accompany sb
to purchase/to buy/to do one's shopping/purchasing agent/buyer
to bribe/to get (luggage) ready/to put in order/to organize things/(baseball) RBI (run batted in)
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to buy on a considerable scale/to purchase/to procure/to stock up
to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
